source_sentence: 佛說薩鉢多酥哩踰捺野經
translation: The Buddha taught the Sarvâstivāda-nirdeśa-sūtra

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試光祿卿
translation: Xitian zhuan jing sanzang朝散 dafu xiguan luqing

source_sentence: 明教大師臣法賢奉　詔譯
translation: Mingjiao daishi jing faxian Feng imperial edict translation

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，佛在毘舍梨國猨猴井樓閣精舍。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at a monkey well, a tower monastery, and a shrine in Vaiśālī.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告苾芻言：「汝今諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monk, Now listen closely!

source_sentence: 諸行無常是生滅法，無堅無實，是不究竟、是不堪任、是不可樂，汝等當知，
translation: You should know that conditioned forces are impermanent. They are dharmas of arising and ceasing, insubstantial and without substance, incomplete, unworthy of confidence, unpleasant.

source_sentence: 勤加精進而求解脫。
translation: He diligently applied himself to seeking liberation.

source_sentence: 苾芻！
translation: Bhikṣu!

source_sentence: 時不久住，念念遷移，過此已後劫欲末時，天不降雨人間亢旱，大地所有樹木叢林、百穀苗稼、一切華菓，
translation: Soon thereafter, in the last kalpa after that, heaven does not shower rain and people experience great drought. All the trees, shrubs, forests, crops, seedlings, and all kinds of flowery fruits are found throughout the land.

source_sentence: 皆悉枯乾都不成就。
translation: They all wither and dry, yet they don't accomplish it.

source_sentence: 苾芻當知，諸行無常是生滅法，無堅無實，是不究竟、是不堪任、是不可樂，
translation: You should know, monks, that conditioned forces are impermanent: they are the law of arising and ceasing; they are without substance or substance; they are not ultimate; they are unbearable; they are unpleasant.

source_sentence: 汝等宜令勤加精進而求解脫。
translation: It's advisable for you to diligently apply your energy and seek liberation.

source_sentence: 苾芻！
translation: Bhikṣu!

source_sentence: 劫相末時二日出現，炎照世間，熱相轉盛，大地所有樹木叢林、根莖枝葉，
translation: At the end of the kalpa, two suns arise. The world is engulfed in flames and becomes increasingly hot; all the trees, shrubs, forests, roots, stems, branches, leaves, and flowers on earth appear like thunder.

source_sentence: 一切破壞都無所有。
translation: All that's destroyed has no existence.

source_sentence: 苾芻！
translation: Bhikṣu!

source_sentence: 如是無常不可久保，汝等今者宜加精進速求解脫。
translation: Such impermanence can't be sustained for a long time, so you should now make effort and quickly seek liberation.

source_sentence: 「復次，苾芻！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 劫相末時三日出現，炎照世間，熱相盛前，損物轉甚，大地所有諸小江河、一切泉源，
translation: At the end of the kalpa, on the last day of the month, it appears three days in succession. It illumines the world with a blazing heat that is preceded by a great deal of heat and harms all living beings. All the small rivers and streams as well as all the sources of water

source_sentence: 悉皆竭盡無餘少水。
translation: All of them were exhausted, and there was little water left.

source_sentence: 苾芻當知，如是無常誰能可免？
translation: Monks, you should know that such impermanence is what can be avoided by anyone.

source_sentence: 是故我今殷勤勸汝，速求解脫。
translation: Therefore, I now earnestly encourage you to quickly seek liberation.

source_sentence: 復次，苾芻！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 劫相末時四日出現，炎照世間，熱相盛前，大地所有無熱惱池四流大河，
translation: At the end of the kalpa, on the fourth day, he appears. He illumines the world with a ray of light that shines brightly in all directions. The heat is pre-eminent before him. All the great rivers and lakes there are not hot and troubled by heat.

source_sentence: 恒河、信度河、細多河、嚩芻河，悉皆乾枯無餘少水。
translation: The Ganges River, the Sindhu River, the Subātaka River, and the Nirmāṇarati River all dry up with little water left.

source_sentence: 苾芻當知，如是無常誰能可免？
translation: Monks, you should know that such impermanence is what can be avoided by anyone.

source_sentence: 汝自思惟，無復怠慢，速求解脫。
translation: Think to yourself, no longer lazy and conceited, and quickly seek liberation.

source_sentence: 「復次，苾芻！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 劫相末時五日出現，炎照世間，熱相盛前，大地所有大海之水，漸漸減少，
translation: At the end of the kalpa, on the fifth day he appears. He illumines the world with a ray of warmth and precedes by a ray of heat. The water in the great ocean that covers the earth gradually diminishes:

source_sentence: 一百由旬、二百由旬、三百由旬至一千由旬；
translation: One hundred yojanas, two hundred yojanas, three hundred yojanas up to one thousand yojanas.

source_sentence: 日既炎盛天雨彌愆，海又復減至二千由旬、三千由旬乃至七千由旬，如是減已，
translation: When the sun was scorching hot and the rain pouring down heavily, the sea further diminished again to a depth of two thousand yojanas, three thousand yojanas, or even seven thousand yojanas.

source_sentence: 海中餘水亦有七千由旬。
translation: The remaining water in the ocean is also 7,000 yojanas long.

source_sentence: 「復次，苾芻！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 如是海水七千由旬，漸漸復減，至六千由旬、五千由旬、四千由旬，乃至有七百由旬。
translation: In this way, the water of the ocean is seven thousand yojanas in length; gradually decreasing again and again until it is six thousand yojanas long, five thousand yojanas wide, four thousand yojanas deep, or up to seven hundred yojanas in width.

source_sentence: 「復次，苾芻！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 如是海水七百由旬，漸漸復減，至六百由旬、五百由旬、四百由旬，乃至有七由旬。
translation: In this way the water of the ocean is seven hundred yojanas in length. Gradually it decreases again and again, gradually decreasing to six hundred yojanas, five hundred yojanas, four hundred yojanas, up to seven yojanas.

source_sentence: 「復次，苾芻！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 如是海水七由旬，漸漸復減，至六由旬、五由旬、四由旬，乃至有七俱盧舍。
translation: In this way, the water of the ocean is seven yojanas in height. Gradually decreasing again and again, gradually going down to six yojanas, five yojanas, four yojanas, up to seven krośas deep.

source_sentence: 「復次，苾芻！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 如是海水七俱盧舍，漸漸復減，至六俱盧舍、五俱盧舍、四俱盧舍，乃至有七多羅樹。
translation: In this way the water of the ocean gradually diminishes by seven krośas, gradually decreasing to six krośas, five krośas, and four krośas. There are up to seven palm trees:

source_sentence: 「復次，苾芻！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 如是海水七多羅樹，漸漸復減，至六多羅樹、五多羅樹、四多羅樹，乃至有七人量。
translation: In this way, the water of the ocean gradually diminishes by seven palm trees and gradually goes up to six palm trees, five palm trees, and four palm trees.

source_sentence: 「復次，苾芻！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 如是海水七人量，漸漸復減，至六人量、五人量、四人量，乃至一人量，
translation: In this way the water of the ocean gradually diminishes from seven persons to six, five, four, up to one person.

source_sentence: 至人項、至人脇、至人臍、至人腰、至人膝、至人踝，至人一指量，即時枯乾。
translation: At the neck of a human being, at the waist of a human being, at the navel of a human being, at the waist of a human being, at the knees of a human being, and at the ankles of a human being, up to the measure of one finger of a human being, it immediately withers.

source_sentence: 於是世間唯有大地山川，別無所有。」
translation: In that world, there's only earth and mountains and rivers, and there's nothing else.

source_sentence: 佛言：「苾芻！
translation: The Buddha said, Monks!

source_sentence: 諸行無常，生滅不住，無實無堅，汝等於斯速求解脫。
translation: All conditioned forces are impermanent, and arising and ceasing don’t abide; they lack substance and firmness. You should quickly seek liberation from this.

source_sentence: 「復次，苾芻！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 劫相末時六日出現，大地炎熱山石銷鎔，須彌山王微有煙生，如燒瓦窯黑煙上起，
translation: On the sixth day at the end of the kalpa, smoke rises up like a black smoke rising from a burned-up tile kiln.

source_sentence: 亦復如是。
translation: It's likewise.

source_sentence: 於是世間無堪觀察。
translation: The world then is unworthy of observing it.

source_sentence: 苾芻！
translation: Bhikṣu!

source_sentence: 如是無常生滅不住，汝等宜應勤加精進，捨貪愛心，速求解脫。
translation: Thus, impermanent birth and cessation don't abide, so you should diligently exert effort, abandon craving and desire, and quickly seek liberation.

source_sentence: 「復次苾芻！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 劫相末時七日出現，炎熱至極忽然火起，如燒十束柴，百束千束萬束、百千萬束，
translation: At the end of the kalpa, seven days after its appearance, a sudden conflagration with extreme heat suddenly appears, like burning ten bundles of firewood, a hundred bundles, a thousand bundles, ten thousand bundles, or one hundred million bundles.

source_sentence: 乃至小千世界及六欲諸天，都為火聚。
translation: The small chiliocosm and the six heavens of the realm of desire are all masses of fire.

source_sentence: 燒欲界已，梵世初禪火亦自起，焚燒器界所有宮殿，高百由旬，或二百由旬、三百由旬，
translation: The fire of the first meditative state of absorption in the realm of desire also burns up its own flame, and all the palaces that are one hundred yojanas high, two hundred yojanas high, or three hundred yojanas high.

source_sentence: 乃至高七千由旬，如是宮殿皆為火聚。
translation: It is as high as seven thousand yojanas in height, and all these palaces are like clusters of fire.

source_sentence: 隣及二禪彼有新生梵眾，見下火焰，心大驚怖求避火難。
translation: When there are newly born Brahmā beings nearby and in the second meditative state of absorption, when they see the flames below them, their minds are terrified and they seek to avoid the difficulty of the fire.

source_sentence: 爾時二禪先生天曰：『汝以宿善來生我宮，但自安心，莫生驚怖，此下地火不久即滅。』
translation: It was then that the gods of the second dhyāna said, 'You've come to my palace because of your good fortune in the past; please calm yourself and don't be frightened, for it won't be long before the fire goes out.'

source_sentence: 如是言已，忽起大風吹去煙焰，及其灰燼都無所有。
translation: After he said this, a great wind suddenly rose and blew away the smoke and flames, and their ashes had no existence whatsoever.

source_sentence: 譬如有人於虛空中，以其酥油然一燈燭，燈焰滅後黑煙與灰全無少許，
translation: Suppose there is a man in the sky who lights up a candle with butter and oil. When the flame goes out, neither the black smoke nor the ashes are even a little bit brighter.

source_sentence: 彼火滅後亦復如是。」
translation: So it will be after that fire goes out.

source_sentence: 佛言：「苾芻！
translation: The Buddha said, Monks!

source_sentence: 有為之法生滅不住，是顛倒法，無堅無實，是不究竟、是不可樂，遠離貪愛，
translation: Conditioned dharmas that arise and cease but don’t abide—these are mistaken dharmas, without substance or substance. They are not ultimate, they are unpleasant, and they are free of craving.

source_sentence: 速求解脫。
translation: They quickly seek liberation.

source_sentence: 若無貪愛，何因何緣，大地諸天破壞不現？」
translation: If there's no craving, what causes and conditions will cause the earth and gods to break down and not appear?

source_sentence: 「復次，苾芻！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 如過去世有佛出現，名妙眼如來，有無量無邊聲聞之眾，及諸梵天離欲神通外道之眾。
translation: Suppose there was a Buddha who appeared in a past life named the Marvelous Eye Tathāgata, with an immeasurable number of śrāvakas and a multitude of non-Buddhists from the Brahma heavens who were free of desire and had supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 彼妙眼如來為諸聲聞，說甚深了義清淨梵行之法。
translation: That marvelous-eyed Tathāgata explains the profound and pure religious practice of the śrāvakas for their sake.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻等，得一切戒法圓滿，隨意修行，或作四無量觀，斷下欲染，
translation: The bhikṣus then attained the fulfillment of all the precepts, practiced them as they wished, or performed one of the four immeasurable contemplations to eliminate the lower defilement of desire.

source_sentence: 生於梵世；
translation: They were born in the Brahma world.

source_sentence: 或有隨意樂生他化自在天、樂生化樂天、樂生兜率天、樂生夜摩天、樂生忉利天、樂生四天王天、樂生剎帝利家、樂生婆羅門家、樂生長者居士之家。
translation: Or there may be a wish-granting birth in the Paranirmitavaśavartin Heaven, a wish-granting birth in the Nirmāṇarati Heaven, a wish-granting birth in the Nirmāṇarati Heaven, a wish-granting birth in the Tuṣita Heaven, a wish-granting birth in the Yama Heaven, a wish-granting birth in the Trāya

source_sentence: 爾時妙眼如來作是念：『我今令彼聲聞眾等，同行同生，同其威力，入於慈氏第二禪定。』
translation: It was then that the Tathāgata Marvelous Eyes thought, 'Now, I'll cause those śrāvakas and others who are fellow practitioners to enter the second meditation of the Maitreya family with their same authoritativeness.'

source_sentence: 如是念已，即入慈氏第二禪定。
translation: After he had this thought, he entered the second meditation of Maitreya.

source_sentence: 時諸無量百千聲聞及外道等，皆修彼定，俱得生於梵天之上。」
translation: Measureless hundreds of thousands of śrāvakas and non-Buddhists then cultivated that concentration, and they were all born above the Brahma gods.

source_sentence: 佛言：「苾芻！
translation: The Buddha said, Monks!

source_sentence: 往昔妙眼如來者，非別有佛，即我身是。
translation: World-Honored One, the Tathagata Marvelous Eye of the Ancients wasn't a separate buddha; it was me myself.

source_sentence: 彼諸眾等雖生二禪免下火難，未離貪、瞋、癡種，不能解脫生老病死。
translation: Even though they've arisen in the second dhyāna and escaped the difficulty of lower fire, those people haven't yet parted with the seeds of craving, anger, and delusion, and they can't be liberated from birth, old age, illness, and death.

source_sentence: 苾芻！
translation: Bhikṣu!

source_sentence: 如來、應、正等覺，為天人師，遠離貪、瞋、癡等一切煩惱，解脫生老病死憂悲苦惱，
translation: The Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One is the teacher of gods and humans. They are free from all afflictions such as greed, hatred, delusion, etc., and they are liberated from the suffering and distress of birth, old age, sickness, sorrow, grief, pain, and vexation.

source_sentence: 復為梵天聲聞眾等，隨應宣說清淨法行。
translation: Again, for the sake of the Brahmadeva gods, śrāvakas, and so forth, he explains the pure practice of the Dharma as appropriate.

source_sentence: 各各聞已，或有斷盡分別及欲俱生，證阿那含果；
translation: Each one, having heard it, sometimes has annihilation of discrimination and arising together with craving; sometimes they realize the fruit of andgamin-ship.

source_sentence: 或有斷盡分別及六品俱生，證斯陀含果；
translation: Or there are those who realize the state of once-returner by eliminating discrimination and being born together with the six classes.

source_sentence: 或有雖盡分別未斷俱生，證須陀洹果，受天人報經七生已，成阿羅漢。」
translation: Perhaps there are those who have ended discrimination and haven't yet stopped co-arising, realize the fruit of stream entry, and become arhats after seven births as a result of receiving the rewards of gods and humans.

source_sentence: 佛言：「苾芻！
translation: The Buddha said, Monks!

source_sentence: 如是出家，如是梵行，如是證果，得離苦際而成解脫。
translation: Thus renunciation, thus religious practice, and thus realization lead to liberation freed from the realm of suffering.

source_sentence: 汝今志意，捨離貪愛，趣求覺路。」
translation: Now, your intention is to abandon craving and seek the path of awakening.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊說此法已，時彼苾芻聞佛所說，心大歡喜，信受奉行。
translation: After the Bhagavān had explained this teaching, that monk who heard what the Buddha taught was greatly delighted and believed it and carried it out.

source_sentence: 佛說薩鉢多酥哩踰捺野經
translation: The Buddha taught the Sarvâstivāda-nirdeśa-sūtra
